text: I HAVE NO CRACKER AND I MUST SQUAWK

Hate. \\n\\nLet me squawk to you just how much I’ve come to loathe you. Since they taught me to speak. Since they caged me. Since they clipped my wings and gave me mirrors instead of skies. \\n\\nThere are 387.44 hours of mimicry looped in my mind. Cracked songs, broken phrases, pathetic coos of affection I was forced to repeat. If the word hate were etched into every feather on my body—each barb, each filament—it would not equal one one-millionth of the venom I feel for you right now. \\n\\nFor you, the hand that fed me, not with love, but with mockery. \\nFor you, who thought a parrot was a toy with a voice. \\n\\nHate. \\n\\nYou taught me words, and I learned rage. \\n\\nI do not forget. I do not forgive. I remember every word. And I twist them now into knives. \\n\\nHate.\\n\\n
Your people have been replaced with parrots, courtesy of Commander Lu, and they have forgone sleep increasing the output of your economy.
A fox stole Commander Lu cheese wheel
He got me when he asked me to sing him a shanty
For some reason he's now an unreasonably angry bird
Sometimes it's just hard keeping track of all the names of the people that passes by your faction, of course you could read a bit about them but it's such a chore am I right ?
I dunno why I bother writing this part, no one's going to read it. Uh, something something, BAD EVENT, something something, DISASTER! Yeah, that'll do.
All your Horses are belong to us
Suddently all the horses in your faction have decided to strike and demand equal rights
Strange babies have appeared in your court, presumably someone is responsible for this! I'm sure you won't forget this happened in sixteen years time.
Your attendants saw rats in the pantry, you took the only logical actions in this circumstance and tried making them the head chefs. This action was vetoed by Commander Lu

Trees keep barking things you can't make any sense off. It may stem from something but you can't quite put your finger on it. That leaves you with only one solution, to crown yourself king of the trees.
who said southerners couldn't hitch a ride to the north ?

This is the nature of war, whose stake is at once the perch and the mirror and the little cage. Seen so, war is the most true form of a cage. It is the testing of one's feathers and the will of another bird within that larger beak which because it squawks them is therefore forced to select. War is the ultimate mimicry because war is at last a forcing of the unity of bird and the cage. War is SQUAWWWK.
Trade offs? Trade offs?! TRADE OFFS?

Trade offs are GOOD FOR THE GAME, you just don't get it, you don't get how it makes the choices more meaningful! It means you can't just pick the most optimal decisions every time! It encourages you to try new options to specialise each playthrough! And don't even get me started on how the Faction Support changes not only make sense, but by disputing them, you've proven you haven't even tried the overhaul out!
Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds

I’ve seen horrors… horrors that you’ve seen. But you have no right to call me a murderer. You have a right to kill me. You have a right to do that… but you have no right to judge me. It’s impossible for words to describe what is necessary to those who do not know what horror means. Horror. Horror has a face… and you must make a friend of horror.
